description:
Xie Lian, the crown prince of Xian Le Kingdom, successfully ascends to Heaven during his third trial in spite of successive demotions. However, he accidentally breaks the Gold Palace of heavenly officials. With no human worshiping him, Xie Lian has to descend to the secular world to exorcise ghosts, which may help him sustain his divinity.

(Source: Funimation)
hashtag: #天官赐福 #天官賜福 #TGCF #天官赐福动画
synonyms: La bendición del oficial del cielo

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Wuxia
tags.description: Chinese fiction concerning the adventures of martial artists in Ancient China.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

node.description:
__Height:__ 160 cm

[Website](http://www.amamiyasora.jp/) | [Profile](http://musicrayn.com/amamiya_sora) | [Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/amamiyasorablog/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc4xpujLxnUBSI1XX-SdldQ) | [Second YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2oaLFNojVzLwQaA5KJOy3g) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Amamiyastaff) 

While a sophomore in high school, Amamiya was introduced to a video collection of roles of voice actress [Miyuki Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/95099). Following this, Amamiya decided to become a voice actress.

Amamiya, together with [Momo Asakura](https://anilist.co/staff/118479) and [Shiina Natsukawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118818), passed an audition held by Music Ray'n in 2011, with the three making their voice acting debut in 2012. She made her official music debut for Music Ray'n by performing Akame ga Kill's opening theme "Skyreach." In late 2014, Amamiya, Asakura, and Natsukawa formed the music unit [TrySail](https://anilist.co/staff/144938/), which released its first single "Youthful Dreamer," used as the opening theme to the anime television series Ultimate Otaku Teacher, on May 13, 2015.

Amamiya, together with [Reina Ueda](https://anilist.co/staff/118602) and [Aya Suzaki](https://anilist.co/staff/114834), received the Best New Actress award at the 9th Seiyu Awards in March 2015.

SID (シド, Shido) is a Japanese visual kei rock band, formed in 2003 and signed to Ki/oon Records. Formed by Mao, Shinji, Aki and Yūya, they are known for producing anime songs, such as for Fullmetal Alchemist, Bleach, Black Butler or Magi.

__Members:__
- Vocals: Mao (マオ) 
- Guitar: Shinji 
- Bass: Aki (明希) 
- Drums: Yuuya (ゆうや)
Clint Bickham is an American voice actor and ADR script writer working with Funimation Entertainment/OkraTron 5000 and ADV Films/Seraphim Digital.
